attributes.action: Explain why Mature College Students are discriminated of age+excluded from benefits unlike university students, school-leavers, immigrants, single parents and such-like
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: If a mature person decides to go back to study but grades are out of date to enable them to enter uni & a full-time vocational college course is the only option, if the course is more than 15hrs a wk, they're not entitled to any benefits: counc/house/jobseekers & due to the age of the mature student, they are not entitled to student benefits: bus-pass/tuition fees/loans/EMA.In fact it's impossible for a person who is not in the 16-19 yr old bracket, to return to college. I was told by my Job ctr that I wasn't allowed to work part-time, but If I had a child, I'd be entitled to+study+claim.I was told to give my course up or sell my house to study at college. Encouraged to obtain a child or go homeless!A course comes with a great deal of work without having the pressures of how you are going to live. An unemployed mature coll student,is entitled to NOTHING!The govt promises access to all types+all levels of vocational training for everyone, yet this is true only for Uni students/single parents/immigrants/or if 16-19yrs.For 30+ students to return to college the financial implications are too high.
